intro: Xylopia humbertii, commonly known as the African bitter apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or orange when mature. Xylopia humbertii is valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine. However, it is also known for its toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested in large quantities.
